Basic explanation of words
Gate
(Gate)
m√©n
The entrance and exit of a building also refers to a device installed at the entrance and exit that can be opened and closed: the door. Doorway. Straight to the point.
Something that has a shape or function like a door: an electric door.
Ways, tricks: the way. Doorway.
It used to refer to a feudal family or a branch of a family, but now it also refers to a general family: family. Door style. Door-in-law. Long (zhÂÉ¥g) the eldest son of the door.
Classification of things: divided into categories.
Religious denominations or schools of academic thought: sects. disciple.
Quantifier: a cannon.

["Guangyun" Mo Benqie, Ping Hun, Ming. ]
Traditional characters for "Èó®1". Also known as "ÈñÖ1".
(1) Barrier devices that can open and close the entrances and exits of houses, fences, vehicles and ships.
(2) Entrance and exit of houses, fences, vehicles and ships.
(3) Checkpoints for inspection and tax collection.
(4) In front of the door, at the door.
(5) The shape or function is like a door.
(6) The orifice of the human body.
(7) Entrance and exit that must be passed by land and water.
(8) Doorway; trick.
(9) The starting point of things; the key.
(10) The home of the doctors of the Western Zhou Dynasty, the Spring and Autumn Period, and the Warring States Period. Later refers to family, family.
(11) Family position.
(12) Factions in religious and academic thought.
(13) Shimen.
(14) Category.
(15) Specifically refers to one of the categories used in biological taxonomy.
(16) Attacking or defending the goal.
(17) Refers to the gatekeeper.
(18) Building the portal.
(19) Ancient sacrificial names.
(20) The provincial name of Nanmen Star.
(21) Go terms.
(22) Quantifiers. Used for guns.
(23) Quantifiers. Used for subjects, learning, etc.
(24) Quantifiers. Used for marriage, relatives, etc.
(25) Quantifiers. Used for payments.
(26) Auxiliary words. It's still like that.
(27) Auxiliary words. Suffix, meaningless.
